column1: full and just outside off. Swings in a touch but too far away for him to offer a shot
length and shaping in at middle stump, defended solidly from the crease
back of a length, marginal movement in through the air. Straight through on the angle off the pitch. Left alone
135.7kph, full and wide outside off. No swing this time. Left alone
134kph, back of a length. Angled away, nips back in off the pitch. Once again too wide for a shot
full and angled across the corridor. There for the cover drive, but he lets it go
129kph, back of a length on off stump. Watchfully defended off the back foot
130kph, back of a length and lifting off the surface on a middle stump line. Defended from the crease
133kph, bouncer at a leg stump line. Climbs sharply off the surface and zips through to Blundell as Powell lets this fly over his front shoulder
good length, angled across off stump. Gets the forward stride in very late and very timidly. Thick inside edge dribbles through square leg
back of a length at middle stump. A bit of wobble, but he's safely behind this as he tucks it to square leg's right
139kph, back of a length outside off. Straight through. Left alone
137kph, good length, zips in and climbs at leg stump. Strikes him on the front thigh as he looks to flick
back of a length in the corridor, gets up at him and he defends very late off the back foot
good length outside off, left alone
134kph, good length and in at off stump. Plonks the front leg across and offers the full face as he taps to mid-on
139.7kph, some swing. This is the fullest one he's bowled this morning. Shapes away from off stump. Driven off the toe-end to mid-off
135kph, back of a length and straightening in the corridor. Defended to gully off the outside half
beats the outside edge. Early signs are that this is very fast surface. Skids past Brathwaite's attempted defence from the crease. Should have been forward
back of a length in the corridor, anxiously defended on the back foot
beats the outside edge again. Minimal movement still. Goes after this length ball outside off with no feet
yorker length at off stump. Tapped back down the pitch with a turning bat
he's testing him in that channel. Length ball, angles in at off stump. He looks to defend with soft hands and does it well in the end. Squeezes it past gully off the outside half of the bat
length on leg stump, flicked on the rise to square leg
135.6kph, full and wobbling in towards off stump. Defended back to the bowler on the front foot
back of a length, angled across off stump. Left alone
back of a length, angled across off stump. Defends into his toe off the inside edge
back of a length at leg stump. Flicked to square leg on the rise
138kph bouncer, decent height. Angled across the corridor. Arches and ducks
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, cross-seam ball rises towards off after pitching on middle. No feet from Powell. Prods way in front of his body with an angled bat. Rolls through gully off the leading edge
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full at off stump, brings down a big backlift and taps it to mid-off
137.2kph, nips away from off stump and climbs past the outside edge. Defends slightly inside the line
overpitched on leg stump. Nice looking clip off the toes, straight to mid-on

lovely straight drive. Overpitched on middle stump and he brings down the bat with perfect timing and a straight bat. There's a bit of gap between bat and pad, but he's covered the line and there's no swing. Henry sticks his right hand out and makes contact, but this still beats mid-on
length and swinging in at leg stump. Flicked to fine leg
full and swinging away outside off. Front leg goes across again. He isn't to the pitch as he looks to drive. Back at the bowler off the inside half
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
slight swing back in and nearly breaches the forward block. This is headed for the top of off. He brings the bat down very late and once again the front-foot plant across gets him in trouble
in at off stump again. Once more he's locked on the front foot. It takes the inside edge and bounces past the stumps
struck on the back thigh after being beaten for pace. Lbw appeal is turned down. THis was a length ball climbing and probably hitting him outside off
overpitched and wobbling outside off. No feet on the drive. Gets it down to mid-of with a turning bat
bouncer is too short and too far outside off. Left alone
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
135kph, full and in at off stump. Waits very very late and defends this under his eyes, from the crease
inside edge past square leg. A nervous prod at this. There was slight shape away. He wasn't close enough to the ball
nice. A bouncer that forces the batsman to get out of the way. Just outside off
full outside off, looks for an expansive drive through the covers. No feet and - you guessed it - it's off the inside half of a turning bat
back of a length, fired in at middle stump. Defended to square leg off the inside half
back of a length at leg stump, flicked on the up to square leg
leading edge lands safely in front of the slip cordon. He's leaping as this climbs into his mid-riff. Closes the face too soon on the flick
yikes. This lifts up ferociously outside off and forces Blundell to leap up. Short and just outside off. He was looking to play at that and did well to get the bat out of the way
short and wide. Nicely in place for the cut. He won't take the bait
raps him on the pad in front of middle but that's probably going over. Length ball, wobbles and beats the inside edge
fuller, swinging in from middle and off. Defended into the leg side
full and angled across off stump. Left alone
the first poor ball of the day. Overpitched outside leg stump. Nicely skidding on for him and he punches it through midwicket
full and just outside off. Stylish cover drive finds the fielder at extra
back of a length in the corridor, defended solidly off the back foot
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Drives ambitiously again, without feet. Slices it past point with little control
good length, swinging away from the corridor. Nicely forward this time to defend into the covers
bouncer at off stump, takes his eyes off it and ducks
back of a length, climbing up in the corridor, just above waist height. Left alone
good length and angled in at the corridor. Nice big stride in anticipation of this angle. Defends it down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
beats the inside edge as Brathwaite continues to drive with no feet. Full and just outside off. Just the right pace to induce that shot too. Narrowly misses off stump
length and down leg side
full at leg stump, waits late before flicking his wrists and getting this past square leg
good length, slight shape away outside off. Left alone
full and swinging away outside off. Left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
overpitched just outside off. Not a bad length as he looks for swing. But he gets this straight drive past mid-off, despite the bat coming down really late
glorious. This is a tad shorter than the last one and looks like the perfect length for Powell. Length at off stump. Pummels it past the non-striker with a full face
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, defended from the crease
bouncer at middle stump, ducked comfortably
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg's right, and fine leg's left
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
nearly takes off stump again. Brathwaite is offering an easy passage between bat and pad far too often. This time de Grandhomme nips it back in off the surface from a length
poor ball. Short and wide outside off. Stands tall and - a tad anxiously - taps this with soft hands through point
full and wide outside off, driven confidently on the rise through the covers. Extra cover gives chase and puts in a slide
back of a length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot

outside edge falls short of third slip. Jeet Raval there, lunges forward and to his left. Brathwaite, even on a shaky day, is a soft-hands player. Saves him as he prods inside the line of this length ball outside off
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at middle stump, watchfully poked into the leg side
back of a length in the corridor, jumps off the floor and defends into the covers
back of a length, hooping in at off stump. Pushed to square leg with the angle
good length, cuts back in at the corridor from outside off. Solidly blocked
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
short ball at off stump. Gets under it to let it pass
solidly punched on the rise, straight to mid-on
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length outside off, drives on the up to mid-off. The front foot stride follows
nicely played. This climbs from a short length and is headed for his ribs. Gets on top of the bounce as he leaps and takes the bottom hand off as he drops it fine
bouncer, down leg side. He won't play at it
pings off the thigh guard as he looks to tickle this fine. Short ball, comes in off the seam and climbs awkwardly
back of a length, shaped in at the hips. Gets on top and whips it to fine leg's left
short and wide outside off, cut nicely, but straight to point
bouncer. Too short and he doesn't even have to duck
short ball at off stump, punched off the back foot, back at the bowler
short ball at the chest. Defended off the back foot into the leg side. Soft hands
short ball at the ribs. Covers the bounce and dabs it to fine leg off
takes on the hook shot and is very late on it. Flies past his shot as he swivels
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off's left on the up
back of a length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
length and angled across middle stump. Defended solidly on the back foot
stands tall and drives this elegantly. Beats mid-off to his right. Length ball driven on the rise, with a high elbow

Powell survives a run-out chance as he huffs and puffs and stretches languidly to try and make it at the striker's end. It's a length ball that swings in at Brathwaite's off stump. He pushes at it gingerly and gets it to mid-off's left. It's Boult there and that's straight at his bowling arm. He can't hit the stumps

gorgeous. Powell has looked so good with the drives. Hit them so straight. This is a length ball in at leg stump and once more, he stands tall and punches it on the rise past his partner. Probably looking to hit him after last ball
bouncer, down leg side. No shot offered
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at off stump. Nicely defended on the back foot
length ball, way down leg side. Blundell puts in his first dive at international level
back of a length outside off. Covers the off stump and lets it go
good length outside off, on the front foot to cover off stump. Left alone
top edge sails over the keeper and carries over the boundary. Late on the hook shot. There is still plenty of skid on this surface. He was looking to drag it square from outside off
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, skids and rises to catch him on the inside of his thigh as he leaps to try and flick this. He's on the floor
nicely bowled. Goes full and at off stump. Slight wobble in the air and he prods it into the covers off the outside half of the bat. Caught on the back foot.
short ball at off stump, defended at chest height
gloves the pull shot between keeper and leg gully. It's the first instance I can remember of Powell going after the short ball today. This one is short and angled down leg. Wasn't entirely in control
short ball at middle stump, jumps off the pitch and dead-bats it in front of short leg
back of a length and down leg side, clipped to fine leg

got him! A flamengo fend? A nervous push? An ugly jab? All of the above. Brathwaite was in no position against this short ball. It's at his rib cage. His weight is going backwards and he's going down after being aerial for a bit - perfect recipe for a lob to short leg. Wagner plays to his strengths after two overs of experimenting and makes the breakthrough
good length and slight shape away from off stump. Defended on the front foot
Powell is still at it. Another straight drive crunched past the bowler. Full and just outside off. Stands tall, bisects bowler and mid-off
full at off stump. Plonks the front leg across and just manages to get the bat in front and push this to mid-on
length at off stump, driven on the up to mid-on
good length at middle stump. Angled bat comes down at this. Leading edge to mid-off
overpitched on middle stump. Nicely flicked. That pings off the bat with a sweet sound but mid-on dives to his left to save four
back of a length outside off, left alone
short and in at the hips. Nicely controlled glance to leg gully's right
back of a length outside off. Waits and opens the face to get it wide of gully
short ball outside off. Arches into the leg side and lets it sail
bouncer outside off. Nicely defended with soft hands
bouncer goes down leg side, he leaves it alone
nearly chips to mid-off. Length ball digs into the pitch and rises as he pushes in front of his body. It falls short of de Grandhomme
full and straight. Defended very very late on the front foot, off the inside half
back of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
full at off stump, driven gently to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
leaves this bouncer alone outside off

stunning on-drive from the youngster. Looks well organised. This length ball is angled in at his leg stump. He's late on it and has to hit it on the up. In the end, it's a bit of a shovel. Beats mid-on to his right
bouncer is too short and a touch down leg side. He gets under it and leaves
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, dabbed to short leg with soft hands
drops his bat and lets this bouncer through in the corridor
back of a length outside off, forced wide of mid-off on the up

another good-looking stroke. Full and in at leg stump. His head falls into the off side as he gets under and flicks it aerially through midwicket. Not quite from the Caribbean if you don't flick with the flourish, eh?
past the outside edge. Length ball in the corridor. Pokes at it, beaten. Went straight through
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
overpitched and into the pads. He can't get bat on the flick. It's very full but it's going down leg. New Zealand withdraw the appeal

lobs towards third slip and he lunges forward to take it in front of second. Powell's been leaving for line outside off, but this one surprises him as it climbs in the corridor. Fends at it and gets glove as he appears to withdraw from the shot. Raval goes to his right, with both hands, and latches onto this. A solid innings comes to an end
short and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length and in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side
back of a length in the corridor. Can't get on top of this as he looks to punch through the covers
shot. Short and wide outside off. Swishes the wand at this and controls it well enough to keep it down and find the gap between gully and cover point
back of a length at off stump defended on the back foot

another one with the short ball! A steep one, rising quickly at his throat. He doesn't look to get on top of the bounce. Instead, he's halfway between swaying away and defending. The bat is pointed upwards, the body is arching back and the feet are rooted. Guides it into the slip cordon and it's an easy take
nicely timed. Back of a length on leg stump. Stands tall and taps it to fine leg's left

has he got a a feather on that? Yes he has! Glove, it sounds like. And Hope walks back in the direction of the dressing room. A loose ball, really. Short and leg stump, by no means a bouncer. It's the kind of ball you tuck off your hips. Hope goes for the pull shot instead and he's late on it. It takes glove and flies over leg stump, straight to Blundell
short and darting away outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
he lands on the pitch as he sways out of the line of this bouncer. It's angled in at his face and he does well in the end
full and wide outside off, left alone
overpitched, wide outside off stump. Left alone
back of a length and slanted away from off stump, stabbed to gully, away from the body

hit wicket first ball in Test cricket. Oh the sound came straight away after he played a decent shot. The crushing sound of despair for the debutant. Put down another wicket to the short ball. This climbs at his chest. He's deep in the crease and then shuffles back further. Leaps up to tuck this to fine leg off this hips but his back heel lands on the stumps. Fine leg is the first to spot it. Points at the stumps as he runs in to field. The batsman knew straight away. Wagner is amused, can't believe his luck
full at leg stump, tapped to mid-on
short and down leg side. Jumps into the off side and looks to whip it. Away from the body, well inside the line
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short at middle stump, defended on the back foot
short at leg stump, stands on his toes and flicks to fine leg
back of a length outside off, defended to cover off the back foot
back of a length outside off. Opens the face and slices this off the back foot through point
ducks under the bouncer at an off stump line
shot. Straight out of the Caribbean. Short ball in at middle stump. Gets high on the back toe, gets the front leg up and across and whips to the square leg fence
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to defend
short ball at the hips. Leaps up and looks to flick. Lobs wide of short leg off his thigh guard
back of a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
nicely played. Short ball at off stump. Gets on top of it, rolls the wrists over it as he pulls and sends it to the midwicket fence
falls short of gully. Fends and opens the face as this rises at his chest
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
uff, get out of the way. This one spits at him from a middle stump line and he has to quickly get inside the line to let it go
good length in the corridor. Feet planted firmly in the crease as he defends this
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
ducks under this bouncer at a leg stump line
back of a length, late swing in. Shovelled to mid-on
good length and down leg side. He can't get bat on the flick and Blundell is late as he gets down to his left
short and wide outside off. Throws his bat at it and slashes it past point
short at off stump, defended on the back foot
short ball down leg side. A quick drop of the head to let it go

glances it straight to leg slip. That's a loose shot from Chase. This is short and down leg side. His weight moves into the off side, he's moving away from the ball and he pokes out at it. Straightforward catch

bowled him! A yorker, an actual yorker from Wagner! Gets some shape in and breaches Holder's defence to break off stump. He's setting up batsmen even before they've come out to bat. He's on a hat-trick again
digs out the yorker and saves...well, does he really? I was going to say saves them some embarrassment. This was angled across off
bouncer climbs above his front shoulder, he's late on it but it's high enough to avoid damage
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
just beats point. Short ball outside off. Takes it on and cuts aerially. Point dives to his right but that's flown
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
wide of mid-off this time. Length ball and he drives aerially with an open face. Mid-off is close in and leaps to his left

run out at the non-strikers! Oh dear. West Indies are unravelling disastrously. Shoddy stuff. This one is full outside off. He looks to drive but it comes back in a touch. It sits up nicely on the bounce for Santner at point. There seems to have been no calling, from either batsman. But for some reason, Dowrich is four yards down and then looking back at the crease in hope as he realises there's no chance to go back. Santner in the mean time gets his technique delightfully right and hits the stumps on the bounce
full and just outside off. Angles in, swings away late, beats the outside edge
short ball in the corridor, drops the wrists and sways away to leave it

lands short of second slip. He's dropping his wrists and arching into the leg side in anticipation of a bouncer. Gets a length ball that it hitting the top of off. It deflects off the face of the bat and drops in front of the fielder
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
good length, slanted across off stump. Beaten on the forward defence
full at off stump, solidly defended into the off side
bouncer outside off, lets it go
just misses off stump. Cummins is defending on the angle, in front of middle stump. It doesn't do that much and misses off
hits off stump this time. Playing for the angle again, and preemtpively evading the line of any potential short stuff. It's a length ball at off. He defends inside the line
overpitched outside off. Slashes at it. Beaten
full at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
good length, in at the pads. Can't get bat on the flick and cops it on the thigh
short at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, angled across off stump. Fishes at it and is beaten
short ball outside off, fishes at it again and gets a thick outside edge to evade second slip

rough. Rough. Top-order batsmen would struggle against this bouncer. Climbs from a length at his helmet. He takes his eyes off it, takes the bottom hand off and holds up his bat in hope. It zips past short leg
full at off stump, pushed to mid-off from the crease
short ball at off stump, defended on the back foot
short ball at off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer at leg stump. Ducks under it
shotttttt. Glorious punch through the covers. Good length, just outside off. All balance as he executes this perfectly. Nothing wrong with this pitch
checks the punch this time. Another length ball outside off. Stabbed through the covers
beaten as he looks to drive through the covers again
back of a length, angled across the corridor. Beaten as he feels for it
short ball down leg side, lets it go
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
short ball, gets him to fend in front of the body and then nips away to beat the outside edge
bouncer is short enough for him to get out of the way easily
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
bunts it aerially but he gets it between short leg and leg gully. Back of a length ball on the hips
back of a length in the corridor, pokes at it. Beaten on the outside edge
good length at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short ball at off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
back of a length on leg stump. Cops it on the thigh as he looks to get inside the line and tickle this fine
length outside off, slices it uppishly towards point
nicely done. Keeps this back foot defence down after adjusting late to get behind the bouncer
short ball, slanted across the corridor. Too fast for him. He's beaten
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length, climbing up in the corridor. Beaten on the forward defence
back of a length. Angled in at off stump and then nipping away. Beaten by a long way
full and just outside off, pushed to mid-off
on-drive...rolls through mid-off. It's a full ball at middle stump. He drives nicely towards the open mid-on region but Gabriel fails to get his bat up quickly. Deflected past mid-off
back of a length outside off, climbs past the outside edge
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on
short at off stump, solidly behind to defend into the off side
length outside off. Looks to drive through the line and into the covers. Taps it past the non-striker in the end. The face closed
short ball climbing brutally at an off stump line. Too good for No. 11. He's beaten

Williamson reviews a caught-behind decision. Blundell took the catch and leaped straight away as he chucked the ball upwards. It was a short one at his mid-riff. He was looking to flick this and it went through, seemingly past the outside edge. There was no sound...and Snicko shows no spike either. That's not out
another brute but this time he manages to find bat. Unfortunately for him, it lobs over the slip cordon. Bouncer at his chest. He takes the bottom hand off and sways backwards with no control

good length at leg stump. Flicks straight to backward short leg who gestures a throw but doesn't release the ball. Roach had to make some ground after taking off for a run instinticvely, that might have been close
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
outside edge squeezes through the slip cordon. That straightened after angling into the corridor
shot! Stands tall and lift this full ball over the bowler. Such class in that stroke. Full face, high elbow. No feet, but four runs
back of a length at off, defended off the back foot
short ball just outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball in the corridor, tapped into the off side off the back foot
short and at the hips. Gets the glance through backward short leg and out to fine leg
full on the pads. Looks to flick and can't get bat on it, but the deflection off his pads take it wide of both keeper and leg gully

taken at second slip and that's a new career-best for Neil Wagner. He's terrorised the batsmen today. Another one sits on the back foot and pays the price. This is short, angled across off. He's backing away a touch and sticks the bat out away from hso body. Thick edge, taken cleanly with a squat and a reverse cup
nearly gets the outside edge first ball. Wobbly seam on this length ball and it nips past the outside edge as he looks to push this towards mid-on
yorker just outside off, brings the bat down hard at it and squeezes into the off side
good length, on the pads. Nicely timed flick straight to square leg
good length at middle stump, dabbed wide of mid-on with soft hands to steal the single
back of a length at off stump, solidly defended on the back foot
full at middle stump, defended back at the bowler
good length outside off, shapes away. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, nips away off the surface. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length, climbing into the body as he leans in to try and flick this. Cops it on the thigh guard
good length outside off, straight through to the keeper
good length outside off, nips away off the seam. Left alone
full and angled across the left-hander. Left alone
full at middle stump, defended down the pitch on the front foot
good length, angling across middle and leg. Pushed down the pitch off the outside half
back of a length, angled across the channel. Drops the wrists to let it go
136.8kph, short ball at the ribs. Dropped into the turf behind square on the leg side with soft hands
back of a length and cutting away from a leg stump line. Defended with the outside half
short and shaping away outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
nicely worked through the covers. Leans into this length ball outside off and taps it with the weight going forward
back of a length outside off, punched through the covers off the back foot this time. It's straighter than the previous one too and allows the third run
bouncer in the corridor, ducks it
bouncer climbs at a leg stump line, he gets away from it
short ball angled across the corridor this time. Still can't get him to play
good length, in the corridor. Latham doesn't cover the off stump as he lets this go
140.5kph, good length, climbing up in the corridor. That's an edge if he plays. He doesn't
141.3kph, full at middle stump. Pushed back at the bowler
nice line. Very close to the off stump but Latham's trusting the bounce. Leaves another length ball
short and wide outside off, left alone

134.6kph. Short ball in the corridor. He's tentative - wants to leave after committing to play. The blade's pointing down into the turf so this doesn't  fly to gully...he does let it through and releases all the pressure though
short ball climbing sharply in the corridor. Does well to get the hands out of the way
bouncer, too short and down leg side. Ducks it easily
beaten. Short ball outside off, he looks to slash through the covers. Mid-off is the only man in front of square on the off side. He was tempted
short and just outside off. Arches backwards and ducks too. An emphatic leave
length at off stump, gets behind the line and drops it into the off side with soft hands
short and wide, angling away. Left alone
length and slanted across off stump, left alone
gets on top of the bouncer, tucks it past short leg and deftly enough to steal a second to fine leg's right
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
short and wide outside off, waits for it to arrive and carves it gracefully past point
length and straight through outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
overpitched outside off, not quite close enough to put his hands through this cover drive. Taps it into the covers off the toe-end
half-blooded attempt to play the hook. Gets in a tangle and is late on it. It climbs over his shot and flies down leg. Appeal for caught behind is turned down
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers off the back foot
overpitched outside off, driven straight to mid-off
short and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor. Nips back in a touch to cramp him. Poked into the leg side
bouncer surprises him. But he manages to get on top of it and drop it into the leg side. It's also a massive no-ball
bouncer, too short, comfortably ducked
short at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off. Looks to pinch a single in the covers with a push. Raval sends him back
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to wide mid-on off the back foot
short and just outside off, left alone
length outside off stump, slight shape away. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
overpitched just outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length, angling into the corridor. Left alone
short and wide. An aimless prod away from the body. Rolls into the covers
nicely placed. Makes no attempt to get on top of this short ball. Picks it up from chest height and lifts it over backward square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot

another false stroke, he gets away with it. Short and wide outside off, Hope is not at all in control of his pull, the ball lobs over the bowler
short and wide outside off, left alone
the frustration building up. Fantastic short-ball bowling. Climbs steeply on Brathwaite, who gets into an awkward tangle while fending. The ball just pops back up into the off side
another nice short ball down leg, Brathwaite avoids it
another short ball, 135 kph, around off, defended
131 kph, stunning bowling. The effort required at this time of the day. Short on middle and leg, Brathwaite watchfully sways out of the line
slow on off and middle, smothered
shortish on off, Hope goes back and works the ball to midwicket
flat outside off, 87 kph, pushed to cover
too slow and straight, whipped through midwicket for one
flatter delivery outside off, too quick, blocked
very slow on off, waits and waits and waits before defending
overpitched outside off, driven to cover
a low full toss outside off, driven to cover
short and slow on middle and leg, flicked into the leg side
slow on off, smothered
well bowled, pushed through in the air, around off, blocked
on the pads, nudged to midwicket
quick on off, smothered back easily.
87 kph, flight outside off, driven back to the bowler
quick down leg, nudged towards square leg
slow around middle, pushed back towards the bowler
flat and wide, a yorker, Brathwaite very happy to defend. One to go
maiden to finish. Short and slow outside off, defended. And that will be stumps on day 3.
full and straight from Henry, driven straight back
better length, not full but not short either. Defended
nice lines, 129 kph, just outside off, defended into the off side
a tad wide outside off, left alone. Blundell fumbles, but picks the ball up before the ball hits the helmet
a slower delivery outside off, 119 kph, defended to cover, pops up
a maiden to start. Overpitched around off, drilled back at the bowler. No swing, no seam, nothing
overpitched around off, driven to long-on for one. Long-on? What? Why?
pushed through, fullish on leg, smothered back
a bit of flight, on leg, defended
a tad short, Hope picks the length, rocks back and pulls through square leg for a run
nice, but the line is a bit leg side-ish. Defended
85 kph, some drift around off, defended
132 kph, bouncer down leg, pulled nicely down to fine leg. On top of the bounce to go from top to bottom, keeping it on the ground
good length on off, 133 kph, defended
another bumper, a bit too high though and wide called
full around off, 131 kph, defended into the off side
a full toss outside off, looking for the slower ball, goes wrong. Brathwaite improvises a defensive dab through point
134 kph, a low full toss outside off, chipped away to cover
good end. On a length outside off, blocked back
more drift, flat outside off, defended into the off side
full outside off, but too quick, pushed to cover
91 kph, quick and straight, kept out
82 kph, overpitched around middle, pushed down to long-on
84 kph, more flight outside off, just drift,  no turn, pushed to cover
a tad quick and short, punched to midwicket. Tidy start from New Zealand. But absolutely nothing happening
a short delivery but strays down leg, an ODI wide. Brathwaite lets this one go
strays on the pads again, worked behind square. Fine leg has to get across so enough time for a couple
better angle. Full around off, defended back
full on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
nicely worked off the pads to midwicket, angled into middle and leg
full around off, 129 kph, defended back
overpitched and straight, defended
nicely tossed up outside off, Brathwaite gets forward to defend
85 kph, full and straight, played into the midwicket region
nicely bowled, quick outside off, easily played though
good delivery. Short and slow outside off, defended into the off side
a maiden. Full on off, pushed back.
119 kph, full around off, defended
overpitched outside off, not able to time his drive well, finds mid-off
122 kph, a gentle half-volley outside off and Hope finds cover with a drive. Should be putting those away
full again, outside off, pushed to cover
121 kph, on the pads this time, worked towards mid-on
full around off, defended
short and wide outside off, scythed away towards point
flight outside off, pushed to cover
nicely bowled, some flight on middle and leg, driven to mid-off
darted in on middle and leg, smothered out
shortish outside off, keeps a tad low, worked into the leg side, towards midwicket
another maiden from Santner. Lots of flight on off, defended
full and straight, some inward shape, pushed to mid-on
126 kph, overpitched around off, driven to mid-on again. Not much happening here in Wellington
worked wide of midwicket for one to mid-on
123 kph, good length outside off, dabbed with the straight bat to gully
keeping it tight around off, defended
digs this in short on off, pulled to deep square leg
short and slow around off, defended from the back foot
misreads the length of that, goes back to a full delivery but improvises easily to defend
short and slow outside off, punched to cover from the back foot
quick outside off, he stays back to defend
pushes this one though outside off, driven into the body of silly point
whew, somehow it misses off stump. Slides on, no turn. Flat outside off, Hope lets it go but the ball keeps drifting on to beat off stump by not very much
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
left alone outside off
gets this to shape back in from his wide-of-the-crease angle, worked into the leg side
full and straight, defended easily
full and wide outside off, no stroke
full and straight, worked to wide mid-on to spoil another maiden
too full outside off, driven to cover
much quicker in the air outside off, kept out
quick on middle and leg, shovelled into the leg side
strays on the pads this time, Brathwaite flicks fine, just enough bat on that to get him four through fine leg. First boundary of the day

pad or bat first? If it's pad, that's probably out. New Zealand take the risk and review. Flat and straight, keeps sliding on. Brathwaite goes back, gets his bat down on it too late, the ball goes on to kiss the back pad before hitting the bat. Three reds on HawkEye and the decision is overturned. Brathwaite was fooled slightly by the length, because it was short and quick, he went back. But should have played it with a straighter bat
overpitched outside off, driven to cover
nicely played from Hope. Strides forward and caresses a drive through cover. The sweeper point fielder gets around
on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
full around off, defended back
120 kph, digs it in down leg, Chase gets underneath that
full and wide, Chase goes after it but skews the ball towards cover
flat and wide outside off, glided off the open face to third man
short down leg, Hope misses a simple flick and is struck down leg
crisply cover-driven towards extra cover
short and quick down leg, worked to midwicket
goes through Blundell. Flat and wide outside off, Hope watches it go through his legs and to the boundary
nice finish, slow around off, defended watchfully
good length outside off, some movement back in, left alone.
angled across the right-hander outside off, left alone well
good bowling now. Full and straight, looking to open up the bowled and lbw options. Chase flicks but finds wide mid-on to his right
pushed across this time, still too wide, left alone
another clever delivery. Goes around the wicket and gets the ball to jag back in from there, worked back
chipped towards midwicket. Full and straight from over the wicket, around leg, Hope plays a tad early, flicks to midwicket
full outside off, 130 kph, left alone
looking for the surprise yorker. On the pads, chipped away into the leg side
drags his length back slightly, full around off, defended
full and straight again, blocked
sees the length early, gets on top of the bounce and nails his pull through backward square. Easily put away, rolled his wrists on it
good length on the pads, worked away to square leg from the crease
getting it to shape back in ever so slightly. Full outside off, driven to cover
a good bouncer down leg, Chase gets underneath that again
139 kph, full outside off, hardly any movement, driven to mid-off
the loose shot. Lulls Chase into a drive with a juicy half-volley outside off. Goes past the edge as Chase wafts
good length and straight, defended
back of a length in the corridor, defended from the crease
full and wide outside off. Puts in a big stride and drives gloriously, straight to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length on off stump, defended to gully
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
lovely shot. Short one into the mid-riff, watches it on and swivels on the back foot as he keeps this pull shot down to bisect fine leg and deep square
good length, across the corridor with no movement. Left alone
good length, wide outside off, left alone
superb. Leans into the full ball outside off and drives with a high elbow to beat extra cover
short and wide outside off, frees his arms and chops this forcefully through backward point
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off stump, driven firmly to mid-off's left
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer in the channel, sways away from it rapidly as he drops the wrists
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
whipped through midwicket. This is full and in at the stumps. He stands tall and stretches his hands well ahead of his body to hit this aerially
back of a length across off stump, left alone

got him at gully. Gets this to lift up at Hope from a length. It's angled across the channel again but is a lot closer to his body. Forces him to try and defend off the back foot. He doesn't do much wrong. Is just late on it because of the extra bounce. The edge loops in front of gully who takes a simple catch
goes back in the crease a long way and defends awkwardly against a full ball
full outside off, left alone

opens his Test account with a six. What an eventful debut this guy has had so far. Not in control of this though. It's a short ball at his chest that he's looking to pull. Gets under it and it's a top edge that flies fine
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
full at middle stump, flicked to mid-on's right
full and just outside off, driven back nervously to the bowler, no feet
back of a length a middle stump, shovelled off the thigh to fine leg's right
full at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
back of a length outside off, left alone
full and shaping in towards the corridor. Hard hands as he looks to lean in and drive past mid-off. Only manages to poke it off the toe-end
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to mid-on
short ball at middle stump, tapped to fine leg with a pull shot
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers
well played. Full face, to the pitch, driven past the non-striker

pierces the covers this time. Another full ball outside off. He opens his wrists and slices this. Extra cover dives to his left and probably gets a little on this because it has puled up inside the boundary
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone

chops it on. Chases a wide ball outside off, doesn't get very close to it. It's short but skids through lower than he expects as he pulls out the cut shot. Gets it off the inside edge and it all looks very average as the ball tonks the base of middle stump. Chase is on his knees, exasperated
yorker just outside off, squeezed out
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, doesn't put in a stride. Just stands tall and punches it firmly past the non-striker
short ball, wide outside off stump. Left alone
full at off stump, thick outside edge to gully as he defends with no feet again
good length across the corridor, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
length at off stump, defended watchfully to mid-off
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
squeezed of the inside edge as he pushes aimlessly in front of the body at a length ball on off. Out to fine leg
outside edge falls short of second slip. Not quite the pacey, flying pitch of the last two days now. Gets the edge after drawing him in outside off, but it doesn't carry
smash. Attempted bouncer is too short and just wide enough outside off for him to free his arms fully. He watches it closely too and hammers it to the square leg boundary
full ball outside off. Stands tall and drills this to mid-off
short ball at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length in the corridor, punched down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, tapped into the covers off the toe-end
back of a length at off stump, punched to mid-off
good length at off stump, slight shape away. Defended to point with an open face
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
full at leg stump, driven to mid-on
good length, swinging away outside off. Shuffles and lets it go
good length, down leg side. Can't connect with the flick
can't get bat on another full one down leg side
and again. Overpitched, down leg side, more movement practice to Blundell
full at off stump. Doesn't get forward enough for the drive through the covers. Off the inside half to midwicket
overpitched outside off stump, driven firmly, straight to mid-off. No feet
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended from the crease
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length outside off, cuts in off the seam. Left alone
good length at middle stump, shuffles across and defends very late as this tails towards his pad to trap him
back of a length on middle stump. Shuffles across the whips to fine leg's left
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length and angled across off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length just outside off, defended to point
bouncer across the corridor. Shapes to pull, adjusts to ramp, then wiggles to try and make it a leave

has that carried? Looks like it's short of Latham who's hopping to his right and diving forward to scoop this up with his right hand at second slip. It's a mean bouncer, climbing sharply in the corridor as he sets up on the back foot. He fends at it awkwardly with the body falling into the leg side and lobs it up in the open third slip area
short ball in the corridor, defended on the back foot

120 kph, an awful stroke to start after the break. De Grandhomme just hangs it out there, on a length and wide outside off. Ambris pokes his bat at the ball, a wafty nothing. The ball takes the outside edge and goes straight to Taylor at wide slip. A very leave-able delivery, should have been left
strays down leg for an ODI wide
full and straight, 124 kph, driven back at the bowler
full and wide outside off, left alone easily
fullish and wide outside off, skewed off the outside half for a couple through the vacant point region
full and straight, driven to mid-on. Probing over from de Grandhomme

tame. West Indies falling apart now. It's a full delivery outside off, Dowrich's front foot comes close to the pitch belatedly, all a result of his short deliveries prior to lunch. His hands are quick, but his feet slow, which means his balance is terrible. All it does is help him skew a catch to point off the outside half.
full delivery outside off, pushed to point. Like Dowrich, his front foot is a tad late
goes through with a drive, finds a massive gap through cover, will get three. Wagner won't mind that
a short delivery around off, Holder sways out of the line
nicely bowled, fullish delivery around off, a thick outside edge dies in front of gully

134 kph, Raval has dropped a sitter. Wagner has worked really hard again, and has earned himself these chips. Full outside off, Holder goes through with a drive, but finds cover. Raval spills the reverse-cupped chance, straight at him
drifts on the pads, ricochets off the thigh pad towards fine leg for one
Holder clears his front leg and launches a lofted drive over cover for four. Not a bad option at all
on a length around off, defended
full and straight, some seam movement back in, 124 kph, defended
full and wide, mis-timed to mid-off. Thinks of one does Holder, not there
125 kph, strays on the pads, Holder won't be happy as he flicks to square leg
good length outside off, Roach slashes a square cut through point. Lovely timing
the bouncer around off, Roach ducks hurriedly
hammered away. Full outside off, Roach doesn't move his feet, lets his hands go through the line, but picks out Raval at cover
short of Raval at cover. Full again, outside off, Roach lets his hands through again, but his timing is just not good enough to carry
nice bouncer around off, Roach drops his hands and lets that one go
full and straight, defended to mid-off.
full on middle and leg, out comes the straight bat, driven to long-on

given! Is there bat on that? Given out lbw. It did not carry to first slip. On a length around middle and off, the ball moves back juuust enough to beat the inside edge and strike Roach in front of middle. No bat. Three reds on HawkEye and West Indies are eight down. De Grandhomme's gentle seamers does it again, not scything through but generating sufficient lateral movement
full and wide, 130 kph, left alone
good length delivery outside off, lets it go by
too wide outside off again. A cry of frustration. 128 kph, left alone
hangs it outside off, but Cummins doesn't go fishing.
full delivery outside off, pushed away to mid-off. How will Holder play this now?
pulled nicely to deep square leg, but Holder refuses the run.

Wagner strikes, nine for the match! Another short delivery, but angled across the right-hander. That meant Holder was never going to be in control of the pull, he gets a thick leading edge which lobs up for square leg to take. NZ on the verge of a series lead
another short delivery, down leg, Gabriel ducks
through the gully region for four. Short and wide, Gabriel uses his height to ride the bounce, but in no control whatsoever
short outside off, played away

yikes, what has happened there? Goes through Cummins' flick to hit him right on the front knee, no protection there. Cummins got his bat down so awkwardly that the bat brushed the pad away, exposing his knee. And he goes down writhing in pain.
good length outside off, misses his drive by a mile
full outside off, Cummins backs away and muscles a mis-timed drive through cover
nailed. Full and straight, Cummins backs away and shovels a drive back past his partner. Four through mid-on
a nice yorker on leg, skewed away into the leg side
bouncer outside off, Cummins sways out of the line. Not pretty, but effective
good length outside off, blocked into the off side. The yorker not too far away?
goes short, a bouncer outside off, goes over Gabriel's late pull
short down leg, Gabriel avoids this awkwardly
somehow falls into no-man's land. Another short delivery around off, off the shoulder of the bat towards gully. Terrific bowling
shortish delivery outside off, Gabriel goes after it, no contact
hits him on the body this time. Angles this into his ribs from around the wicket, Gabriel struggles to get out of the way, wears the blow.
another short delivery on off, Cummins backs away and swings, but misses it by quite some distance. The wicket not too far away
short delivery outside off, Cummins sways away
nicely hit. Overpitched outside off from Boult, Cummins leans into a drive and finds the gap through cover, for four
shortish delivery outside off, Cummins avoid that again
four more. Full down leg, Cummins backs away but the ball skews off the inside half and races away to the backward square leg boundary

that's the end of the Test. New Zealand win by an innings and 67 runs to take a 1-0 lead. Full and straight from Boult, only a matter of time before Cummins missed one, he missed this. The ball rattles into middle and off stumps.
